summary: Good place to hang FAANG on your resume
pros: Brand recognition and opportunity to open doors to other companies
cons: Stack ranking and pip process. Every year there is comp change which only benefits the company.

summary: Amazon Core Search Is Highly Political **YOU ARE WARNED**
pros:
+ Variety of work each year
+ Flexibility of movement between teams every 4 months
cons:
- Tamil and Telugu ethnic majority favoring India transfers with promotions
- Narcissistic managers who kiss the arses of their superiors

summary: Good comp but bad culture and WLB
pros:
Comp is competitive
Looks good on resume
Growth is a pro
cons:
Bad WLB
Toxic culture
Tight deadlines, lots of docs to write
Management sucks. RTO5

pros:
-compensation is decent 
-brand value is good. If you say Amazon, people respect
cons:
-WLB
-heavy politics
-people don’t want to help and try to hoard knowledge

summary: Good pay and career start. Not fun
pros: You learn a lot fast. Many things have strong structure in place. Path to L7 is relatively straightforward
cons: Mind numbing  sometimes. You spend 80% of your time reporting and documenting and fine tuning itty bitty language details vs just doing it

summary: Lots of opportunity but work life balance can be rough.
pros: Opportunity, scope, compensation, benefits. Able to rotate internally to roles of interest.
cons: Work life balance, your experience really depends on your direct manager.

pros: Maybe it’s the only company hiring a lot of people?
cons:
Unrealistic goals
Very disconnected to real customer need
Very few promotions in the past 2 years despite owning 2 tier-1 services
Oncall is very bad
Parking garage is full at 9 am every day
Some people with privilege don’t care at all
TC drop with the new rule

This company sucks. I’m never coming back.

summary: Highly dependent on which team you join
pros:
If you join a good and healthy team you may get:
-good wlb
-good coworkers
-fair compensation
-fair visibility into different areas of work
cons:
Generally:
-not much room for growth beyond certain level
-no room for compensation increase
But, if you join a toxic team, forget it - everything becomes a con

summary: Smart People / Lots of Internal Writing
pros: Some of the smartest people you’ll ever work with. A get things done attitude and low performers will be managed out.
cons: Intensive writing culture which takes away from time spent with customers.

pros: High exposure, autonomy, opportunity, scale. Moves fast, decent Work life balance
cons: Depends on your team, role, etc. not good comp growth structure

pros: Learning opportunities are great here. Fast paced environment in most teams.
cons: Workload is high with aggressive deadlines that lead to stress

summary: You get what you put in
pros: Great opportunity to learn about software at scale. Smart people to work with
cons: Very poor work life balance and pressure to deliver constantly

summary: Your growth depends a lot on your org and your team
pros: Comp is nice at Amazon, mostly is >250k for L5.
cons: Management is not that great, the company is obsessed with making profits, because of which innovation gets halted

pros: You can do very interesting and impactful work here. There is usually scope to stretch yourself if you’d like to try something new. My management has been good and tries to reign in work life balance. Coworkers are very smart.
cons: The company culture is strong, but often toxic. Senior leadership has made efforts to make Amazon a more hostile place to work including a 5 day RTO mandate, blanket rejections of medical accommodation requests, and more difficult promotions. Work life boundaries are often crossed in the name of the leadership principles, but good managers can protect you from most of this, despite them being pressured to fall in line. Pay is good, but there is a lack of quality-of-life benefits that other comparable companies offer. There is always implicit pressure to be a high performer due to attrition targets.

pros: Rigorous learning. In two years, I learned more leadership skills than in 17 years elsewhere.
cons: Heavy focus on written culture. While, it is important, it takes away from physically doing the work. Driving across steam alignment is unreasonably complicated.
reasonResign: Unfair pay scale. Had to resign to get what I wanted. It was too late.

pros: Amazon was a great place to start my career and learn from smart engineers developing large scale systems.
cons: Lots of teams at Amazon have slowed growth significantly, which means the work has become very Ops-heavy or at most you're building yet another CRUD microservice. It's challenging to deliver interesting features when you're going on call every 3-4 weeks. PIP and Focus culture result in a very cutthroat, backstabby environment especially when there's very limited hiring and promotions. Leadership will tell you your performance is good and then turn around and put you on Focus for having lower CR counts. Constant reorgs and roadmap pivots nowadays.

pros: A lot of opportunities to upskill. Lots of things to learn
cons: Having a good manager is important. Luckily I have good manager

pros: easy work other than the oncall weeks, good and helpful teammates
cons: terrible growth opportunities, no scope and constant bs politics, poor management

summary: Amazon is good place to work for short term
pros:
Good pay
Great colleagues
Everyday learning 
Day one
Good RSU
cons:
High bar
Tough management 
Contradicting leadership principles 
Short term projects

summary: Slow growth but still overall good
pros: Culture is good you get to learn lot of tools and tech
cons: Management is weak not people mangers they are bad. L7

pros: Pay is ok, opens some doors, some teams can be super good
cons: Bad stuff happens everywhere, might be back stabbing without knowing, bad wlb

pros: Pay is ok but going down, smart coworkers to learn from
cons: Everything else, wlb, incompetent management, politics, rto, list goes on

pros:
Decent TC compared to similar levels at other companies
Decent company if you are in a good org/have a good manager
cons:
15% stock growth baked into comp
5 days RTO
Leadership always finds a new way to screw you

pros: Pay is decent, and there are many smart people who want to get stuff done.
cons: Can be chaotic. Management plays favoritism and making friends matters more than deliverables

pros: Opportunity for growth if you play the game well. Chance to step on to better things.
cons: Lack of boundaries of expected norms leads to highly variant management and team behavior.

summary: High impact work, scattered/redundant at times
pros: Leaned in partners make work interesting and fast paced. Reorg is for the better right now
cons: Money is ok. Visibility into decision making is low at leadership level

pros:
Easy to internally transfer
Career growth looks good
Nothing else
cons:
Poor WLB
Bad culture
Few holidays
RTO 5 days now

summary: Lots of growth but bad WLB
pros: There are lots of growth opportunities available and great comp
cons: Not so much wlb, need to hit the ground running

pros: good company, a lot of opputinites to grow if you put in the effort
cons: depends on team..., sometimes work can be very stressful, choosing the right team is important

pros: The total compensation is good. The office areas are pretty nice.
cons:
WLB is pretty bad and management is awful.
Benefits are bad
